name: unity-integration-advanced
description: Advanced Unity3d Game Engine MCP which supports ,Execution of Any Editor Related Code Directly Inside of Unity, Fetch Logs, Get Editor State and Allow File Access of the Project making it much more useful in Script Editing or asset creation.

examples.title: Get Unity Editor State
examples.description: Retrieve comprehensive information about the current Unity project and editor state.

examples.title: Execute C# Code
examples.description: Run specific C# code directly within the Unity Editor.

MCP_WEBSOCKET_PORT.description: Environment variable to specify the WebSocket port used by the MCP server.

tools.name: get_current_scene_info
tools.description: Retrieve information about the current scene in Unity Editor with configurable detail level

detailLevel.description: RootObjectsOnly: Returns just root GameObjects. FullHierarchy: Returns complete hierarchy with all children.

returns.description: Returns information about the current scene and its hierarchy based on requested detail level

tools.name: get_game_objects_info
tools.description: Retrieve detailed information about specific GameObjects in the current scene

instanceIDs.description: Array of GameObject instance IDs to get information for

detailLevel.description: BasicInfo: Basic GameObject information. IncludeComponents: Includes component details. IncludeChildren: Includes child GameObjects. IncludeComponentsAndChildren: Includes both components and a full hierarchy with components on children.

returns.description: Returns detailed information about the requested GameObjects

tools.name: execute_editor_command
tools.description: Execute C# code directly in the Unity Editor - allows full flexibility including custom namespaces and multiple classes

code.description: C# code to execute in Unity Editor. You MUST define a public class named "McpScript" with a public static method named "Execute" that returns an object. Example: "public class McpScript { public static object Execute() { /* your code here */ return result; } }". You can include any necessary namespaces, additional classes, and methods.

returns.description: Returns the execution result, execution time, and status

tools.name: get_logs
tools.description: Retrieve Unity Editor logs with filtering options

count.description: Maximum number of log entries to return

fields.description: Specify which fields to include in the output

stackTraceContains.description: Filter logs by stack trace content

timestampAfter.description: Filter logs after this ISO timestamp

timestampBefore.description: Filter logs before this ISO timestamp

returns.description: Returns an array of log entries matching the specified filters

tools.name: verify_connection
tools.description: Verify that the MCP server has an active connection to Unity Editor

tools.name: get_editor_state
tools.description: Get the current Unity Editor state including project information

returns.description: Returns detailed information about the current Unity Editor state, project settings, and environment

tools.name: read_file
tools.description: Read the contents of a file from the Unity project. Paths are relative to the project's Assets folder. For example, use 'Scenes/MainScene.unity' to read Assets/Scenes/MainScene.unity.

path.description: Path to the file to read. Can be absolute or relative to Unity project Assets folder. If empty, defaults to the Assets folder.

tools.name: read_multiple_files
tools.description: Read the contents of multiple files from the Unity project simultaneously.

paths.description: Array of file paths to read. Paths can be absolute or relative to Unity project Assets folder.

tools.name: write_file
tools.description: Create a new file or completely overwrite an existing file in the Unity project.

path.description: Path to the file to write. Can be absolute or relative to Unity project Assets folder. If empty, defaults to the Assets folder.

content.description: Content to write to the file

tools.name: edit_file
tools.description: Make precise edits to a text file in the Unity project. Returns a git-style diff showing changes.

path.description: Path to the file to edit. Can be absolute or relative to Unity project Assets folder. If empty, defaults to the Assets folder.

oldText.description: Text to search for - must match exactly

edits.description: Array of edit operations to apply

dryRun.description: Preview changes using git-style diff format

tools.name: list_directory
tools.description: Get a listing of all files and directories in a specified path in the Unity project. Paths are relative to the Assets folder unless absolute. For example, use 'Scenes' to list all files in Assets/Scenes directory. Use empty string to list the Assets folder.

path.description: Path to the directory to list. Can be absolute or relative to Unity project Assets folder. If empty, defaults to the Assets folder. Example: "Scenes" will list all files in the Assets/Scenes directory.

tools.name: directory_tree
tools.description: Get a recursive tree view of files and directories in the Unity project as a JSON structure.

path.description: Path to the directory to get tree of. Can be absolute or relative to Unity project Assets folder. If empty, defaults to the Assets folder. Example: "Prefabs" will show the tree for Assets/Prefabs.

tools.name: search_files
tools.description: Recursively search for files and directories matching a pattern in the Unity project.

path.description: Path to search from. Can be absolute or relative to Unity project Assets folder. If empty, defaults to the Assets folder. Example: "Scripts" will search within Assets/Scripts.

tools.name: get_file_info
tools.description: Retrieve detailed metadata about a file or directory in the Unity project.

path.description: Path to the file to get info for. Can be absolute or relative to Unity project Assets folder. If empty, defaults to the Assets folder.

tools.name: find_assets_by_type
tools.description: Find all Unity assets of a specified type (e.g., Material, Prefab, Scene, Script) in the project. Set searchPath to an empty string to search the entire Assets folder.

searchPath.description: Directory to search in. Can be absolute or relative to Unity project Assets folder. An empty string will search the entire Assets folder.

maxDepth.description: Maximum depth to search. 1 means search only in the specified directory, 2 includes immediate subdirectories, and so on. Set to -1 for unlimited depth.
